text:
Why the heck is Phoebe all the sudden
in love with Chandler? What is this?

Well you will find out in this hilarious clip from Friends
today, while improving your English pronunciation,

vocabulary, and so much more! And if
you are new here, every week we make

fun lessons like this one so you can finally
understand fast speaking natives without getting lost,

without missing the jokes, and without subtitles.
In fact, Swarahita says that they have

improved virtually every aspect of their 
English with our lessons! You will too,

so don’t miss a single new one! Hit
that subscribe button and the bell below now.

All right, so first of all "How Did You"
is almost never said like this.

We say it as if it were one unit. It
almost sounds like just one word
"How Did You""How Did You" Repeat after me, "How Did You".

"How did you get to be so cute?" And pretty much
any time you see Did and You together,

they actually will connect and
that D + Y morphs into a G sound.

So that's why you get dih-jew
similar to how if you said Would You or Could You.

They would morph into woul-jew or coul-jew. Okay,
the preposition TO pretty much always reduces as well

So rarely will you hear it in the full form TO. Usually instead
you'll hear it converted into a schwa sound, so it becomes

So that actually connects then to Get.
So Get To becomes get-tuh.

Isn’t it so frustrating when we natives speak fast,
link our words together, and you can’t understand us?

You are not alone. So many learners 
have told us that this is one of the biggest things

that makes them lose their confidence 
hen communicating in English.

That’s why we made our *Fluent with
Friends* course. So that you can have fun

developing the skills you need to confidently understand natives
whether it is while watching your favorite TV series,

listening to a podcast, or at work or when traveling. I’ve seen
how transformative this course can be for learners like you,

so I want you to try it right now for free with our 3 part
masterclass. Just click up here or in the description below

to sign up. I’m so excited to help you take
the next step on your English fluency journey!

This other hilarious video featuring Phoebe will also help you to
improve your phone English! Let’s check out a clip from that.
